definitions: A person who sees an event, typically a crime or accident, take place.
A person giving sworn testimony to a court of law or the police.
A person who is present at the signing of a document and signs it themselves to confirm this.
Used to refer to confirmation or evidence given by signature or under oath.
Open profession of one's religious faith through words or actions.
A line or remnant of an original surface on a workpiece to show how much material has been removed or the shape of the original outline.
